text: Ancestral delicacy of Taxco, jumiles are edible insects seasoned with salt, lemon, or salsa, often served in tortillas. Considered a cultural heritage food, they are a unique experience for adventurous palates.

A Guerrero classic, pozole verde from Taxco is prepared with hominy corn, pork or chicken, and a green sauce made with pumpkin seeds, tomatillo, and chili peppers. Served with tostadas, radishes, and oregano.

A rare and exquisite dish from Taxco, mole rosa is made with rose petals, almonds, nuts, and spices that create its signature pink color. It is a symbol of the townâ€™s creativity and culinary richness.
